metadata.title: Complete Food Learning Modules for Children

proteins.name: Proteins
proteins.description: Foods that help build strong muscles and give your body energy

learning.summary: Chicken is lean white meat that provides complete protein with all essential amino acids. Chickens are raised on farms where they're fed grain-based diets and cared for safely.
key_facts: Lean white meat with complete protein
Raised on farms with grain-based diets
Versatile and can be cooked many ways

quiz.question: What type of meat is chicken?
quiz.hint: Think about the color you see when chicken is cooked - it's the color of snow!

quiz.question: What do chickens also provide besides meat?
quiz.hint: Chickens lay something round that we eat for breakfast!

quiz.question: What do chickens eat on farms?
quiz.hint: Chickens eat the same kinds of seeds and grains that are used to make bread!

quiz.question: Why is chicken good protein?
options: It has all essential amino acids
quiz.explanation: It has all essential amino acids
quiz.hint: Chicken protein is 'complete' - it has all the building blocks your body needs!

learning.summary: Eggs are complete protein packages from chickens! They have two main parts - the white provides protein while the yolk contains healthy fats and vitamins.
key_facts: Two parts: protein-rich white and vitamin-rich yolk
Laid daily by hens on farms
Can be cooked in many different ways

quiz.question: What animal lays the eggs we eat?
quiz.hint: These farm birds say 'cluck cluck' and have feathers!

quiz.question: What are the two main parts of an egg?
quiz.hint: One part is clear and becomes white when cooked, the other is round and yellow!

quiz.question: Which part of the egg has more fat?
quiz.hint: The yellow, round part in the center has all the healthy fats!

quiz.question: Why are eggs called complete proteins?
quiz.hint: Eggs have all the building blocks your body needs - nothing is missing!

learning.summary: Fish provides excellent lean protein and healthy omega-3 fatty acids! Different types offer varying flavors from mild to rich. Fish can be caught wild or farm-raised.
key_facts: Rich in healthy omega-3 fatty acids
Good for brain and heart health

quiz.question: Where do fish live?
quiz.hint: Fish need to swim in the same thing we drink!

quiz.question: What healthy fats do fish provide?
quiz.hint: These special fats are great for your brain and heart!

quiz.question: How can fish be obtained?
quiz.hint: Fish can come from natural waters or be grown by people!

quiz.question: What makes fish a good protein?
quiz.hint: Fish gives you muscle-building protein without too much bad fat!

learning.summary: Almonds are crunchy nuts that grow on trees with beautiful pink spring blossoms! They're packed with plant protein, healthy fats, and vitamin E for healthy skin.
key_facts: Grow on trees with pink spring blossoms
High in plant protein and healthy fats
Rich in vitamin E for healthy skin
Can be eaten raw or made into almond butter

quiz.question: Where do almonds grow?
quiz.hint: Almonds grow high up where you'd need a ladder to reach them!

quiz.question: What color are almond tree flowers?
quiz.hint: The flowers are the same color as cotton candy!

quiz.question: What vitamin are almonds rich in?
quiz.hint: This vitamin is great for keeping your skin healthy and soft!

quiz.question: What helps almond trees make nuts?
quiz.hint: These buzzing insects fly from flower to flower!

learning.summary: Peas are small, round green vegetables that grow in pods! They're sweet, provide good plant protein, and their plants climb up supports with white or purple flowers.
key_facts: Small, round seeds that grow in pods
High in fiber for digestive health

quiz.question: What shape are peas?
quiz.hint: Peas are the same shape as marbles or small balls!

quiz.question: Where do peas grow?
quiz.hint: Peas grow inside green containers that split open when ready!

quiz.question: What do pea plants need to climb?
quiz.hint: Pea plants are like climbers who need something to hold onto!

quiz.question: What do peas taste like?
quiz.hint: Peas have a naturally sweet taste that makes them fun to eat!

learning.summary: Tofu is made from soybeans and has a mild flavor that absorbs other tastes! It's a complete plant protein that comes in different textures from soft to extra-firm.
key_facts: Complete plant protein with all amino acids
Comes in soft, firm, and extra-firm textures

quiz.question: What is tofu made from?
quiz.hint: Tofu is made from beans that make a white liquid like milk!

quiz.question: What does tofu taste like on its own?
quiz.hint: Tofu is like a sponge - it soaks up the flavors around it!

quiz.question: What textures can tofu come in?
quiz.hint: Tofu comes in different firmness levels, like cheese!

quiz.question: What type of protein is tofu?
quiz.hint: Even though it's from plants, tofu has all the protein building blocks!

learning.summary: Beef comes from cattle and provides complete protein with essential nutrients like iron and B vitamins! Choose lean cuts for the healthiest option.
key_facts: Comes from cattle raised on farms
High in complete protein and iron
Rich in B vitamins for energy
Different cuts have varying fat content
Important source of zinc and iron

quiz.question: What animal does beef come from?
quiz.hint: These large farm animals say 'moo' and eat grass!

quiz.question: What important mineral does beef provide?
quiz.hint: This mineral helps carry oxygen in your blood!

quiz.question: What makes some beef cuts healthier?
quiz.hint: The healthiest beef has less visible white fat!

quiz.question: What vitamins does beef provide?
quiz.hint: These vitamins help your body make energy from food!

carbohydrates.name: Carbohydrates
carbohydrates.description: Foods that give your body energy to run, play, and learn

learning.summary: Butternut squash is a winter squash with sweet, orange flesh that's rich in complex carbohydrates. It grows on vines and has a creamy, nutty flavor when cooked.
key_facts: High in vitamin A for eye health

quiz.question: What color is butternut squash inside?
quiz.hint: The inside is the same color as a carrot or pumpkin!

quiz.question: What type of carbohydrates does butternut squash have?
quiz.hint: These carbs give you long-lasting energy!

quiz.question: How does butternut squash grow?
quiz.hint: Like pumpkins, butternut squash grows on long, trailing plants!

quiz.question: What does butternut squash taste like?
quiz.hint: It has a naturally sweet taste with a hint of nuts!

learning.summary: Corn grows on tall stalks with kernels arranged on cobs! Each kernel is a seed packed with starch and natural sugars for energy. Corn comes in yellow, white, and colorful varieties.
key_facts: Grows on tall stalks with large leaves
High in starch for sustained energy
Each kernel is actually a seed
Comes in many colors and varieties

quiz.question: Where do corn kernels grow?
quiz.hint: Corn kernels are arranged in rows on a central core!

quiz.question: What is each corn kernel?
quiz.hint: Each yellow kernel could grow into a whole new corn plant!

quiz.question: What gives corn its energy?
quiz.hint: Corn has stored energy in the form of natural starches!

quiz.question: How tall do corn stalks grow?
quiz.hint: Corn stalks can grow taller than most people!

learning.summary: Rice is a grain that grows in flooded fields called paddies. It's a staple food providing energy-rich carbohydrates for billions of people worldwide.
key_facts: Grows in water-flooded fields called paddies
Staple food for much of the world
Comes in white, brown, and wild varieties
Each grain is actually a seed

quiz.question: Where does rice grow?
quiz.hint: Rice grows in fields covered with water like shallow ponds!

quiz.question: What does rice provide for your body?
quiz.hint: Rice gives you the fuel your body needs to run and play!

quiz.question: What varieties does rice come in?
quiz.hint: Rice comes in different colors and types, just like bread!

quiz.question: What is each grain of rice?
quiz.hint: Each tiny grain could potentially grow into a new rice plant!

learning.summary: Pasta is made from wheat flour and water, formed into hundreds of different shapes! It provides energy-rich carbohydrates and is cooked in boiling water until tender.
key_facts: Made from wheat flour and water
Comes in hundreds of different shapes
Can be served with many different sauces

quiz.question: What is pasta made from?
quiz.hint: Pasta is made from the same flour used to make bread!

quiz.question: How is pasta cooked?
quiz.hint: Pasta needs very hot, bubbling water to become soft!

quiz.question: How many shapes does pasta come in?
quiz.hint: There are more pasta shapes than you could count!

quiz.question: What does pasta give your body?
quiz.hint: Pasta provides fuel for your body to run and play!

learning.summary: Pumpkins are large, orange winter squashes that grow on vines! They're rich in carbohydrates and beta-carotene. Pumpkins can be carved for Halloween or cooked for food.

quiz.question: What color are most pumpkins?
quiz.hint: Pumpkins are the same color as a basketball or carrots!

quiz.question: How do pumpkins grow?
quiz.hint: Pumpkins grow on long, trailing plants that spread along the ground!

quiz.question: What makes pumpkins orange?
quiz.hint: This nutrient is the same thing that makes carrots orange!

quiz.question: What can you do with pumpkin seeds?
quiz.hint: Pumpkin seeds make a crunchy, healthy snack when cooked!

learning.summary: Potatoes grow underground as tubers and are packed with starchy carbohydrates for energy! They have skin on the outside and can be cooked in many different ways.
key_facts: Have skin on outside, flesh inside
Can be cooked many different ways

quiz.question: Where do potatoes grow?
quiz.hint: Potatoes hide below the soil while green leaves grow above!

quiz.question: What type of carbohydrates do potatoes have?
quiz.hint: Potatoes store energy in the form of starch!

quiz.question: What part of the potato do we usually eat?
quiz.hint: We eat the part that grows underground and stores energy!

quiz.question: How can potatoes be cooked?
quiz.hint: Think about french fries, mashed potatoes, baked potatoes!

learning.summary: Oats are whole grains that provide sustained energy from complex carbohydrates! They're often eaten as oatmeal for breakfast and are high in fiber.
key_facts: Whole grains rich in complex carbohydrates
High in fiber for digestive health
Often eaten as oatmeal for breakfast

quiz.question: What type of carbohydrates do oats provide?
quiz.hint: These carbs give you long-lasting energy, not quick sugar rushes!

quiz.question: When are oats most commonly eaten?
quiz.hint: Think about a warm, creamy bowl that starts your day!

quiz.question: What makes oats good for your tummy?
quiz.hint: This nutrient helps food move through your system smoothly!

quiz.question: How do oats give you energy?
quiz.hint: Oats keep you energized for hours, not just minutes!

learning.summary: Quinoa is a special seed that's cooked like a grain and provides both carbohydrates and complete protein! It comes from South America and has a nutty flavor.
key_facts: Actually a seed, not a true grain
Complete protein with all amino acids
Has a nutty flavor and fluffy texture

quiz.question: What is quinoa actually?
quiz.hint: Even though it's cooked like rice, quinoa is actually a tiny seed!

quiz.question: What makes quinoa special for protein?
quiz.hint: Quinoa has all the protein building blocks your body needs!

quiz.question: What does quinoa taste like?
quiz.hint: Quinoa has a mild flavor that reminds people of nuts!

quiz.question: Where does quinoa originally come from?
quiz.hint: Quinoa comes from the same continent as the Andes Mountains!

learning.summary: Sweet potatoes are orange root vegetables that grow underground and are naturally sweet! They're rich in complex carbohydrates and very high in vitamin A.
key_facts: Orange root vegetables that grow underground
Very high in vitamin A for eye health

quiz.question: Where do sweet potatoes grow?
quiz.hint: Like regular potatoes, sweet potatoes hide below the soil!

quiz.question: What color are sweet potatoes inside?
quiz.hint: The inside is the same color as a carrot or pumpkin!

quiz.question: What vitamin are sweet potatoes rich in?
quiz.hint: This vitamin helps you see well and keeps your eyes healthy!

quiz.question: How do sweet potatoes taste?
quiz.hint: These potatoes taste like they already have sugar in them!

vegetables.name: Vegetables
vegetables.description: Nutritious plants that we eat, including roots, leaves, stems, and flowers

learning.summary: Asparagus are green spears that emerge from the ground in spring! They're young shoots that take 2-3 years to grow before first harvest. Asparagus comes in green, purple, and white varieties.
key_facts: Green spears that emerge in spring
Comes in green, purple, and white varieties
High in vitamins K and folate

quiz.question: What does asparagus look like?
quiz.hint: Asparagus spears are shaped like green pencils or arrows!

quiz.question: How long before asparagus can be harvested?
quiz.hint: Asparagus needs time to grow strong roots before harvesting!

quiz.question: What colors can asparagus be?
quiz.hint: Asparagus comes in more colors than just green!

quiz.question: When do asparagus spears emerge?
quiz.hint: Asparagus pops up when the weather gets warm after winter!

learning.summary: Beets are round root vegetables with deep red color and leafy green tops! They grow underground and have a sweet, earthy flavor. Both the root and leaves are edible.
key_facts: Round root vegetables with red color
Grow underground with leafy tops above
Both roots and leaves are edible

quiz.question: What color are most beets?
quiz.hint: Beets are the same color as a fire truck!

quiz.question: Where do beets grow?
quiz.hint: Like carrots, beets hide their colorful roots below the soil!

quiz.question: What parts of a beet can you eat?
quiz.hint: Nothing goes to waste with beets!

quiz.question: How do beets taste?
quiz.hint: Beets have natural sweetness with a taste that reminds you of soil!

learning.summary: Broccoli looks like tiny green trees and is actually flowers we eat before they bloom! It grows in cool weather and is packed with vitamins C and K.
key_facts: Actually flowers we eat before blooming
High in vitamins C and K
Turns into yellow flowers if not harvested

quiz.question: What does broccoli look like?
quiz.hint: Think about miniature forests!

quiz.question: What part of the plant is broccoli?
quiz.hint: We eat the part that would turn into colorful blossoms!

quiz.question: What weather does broccoli prefer?
quiz.hint: Broccoli likes sweater weather!

quiz.question: What happens if broccoli isn't harvested?
quiz.hint: The green part opens up to reveal sunny-colored blossoms!

learning.summary: Bell peppers are colorful, sweet peppers shaped like bells! They start green and change to red, yellow, or orange as they ripen. They're very high in vitamin C.
key_facts: Start green, change colors when ripe

quiz.question: What shape are bell peppers?
quiz.hint: Think about what rings in a church tower!

quiz.question: What color do bell peppers start as?
quiz.hint: Young bell peppers are the same color as grass!

quiz.question: How do bell peppers taste?
quiz.hint: Bell peppers are mild and pleasant, not hot!

quiz.question: What vitamin are bell peppers rich in?
quiz.hint: This vitamin helps keep you healthy and fight colds!

learning.summary: Carrots are orange root vegetables that grow underground with green leafy tops above! They're crunchy, sweet, and packed with beta-carotene for healthy eyes.
key_facts: Green leafy tops grow above ground
High in beta-carotene for eye health

quiz.question: Where do carrots grow?
quiz.hint: You only see the green tops - the orange part is below!

quiz.question: What color are most carrots?
quiz.hint: Carrots are the same color as a basketball!

quiz.question: What part of your body do carrots help?
quiz.hint: Think about the part of your body that helps you see!

quiz.question: What grows above ground from carrots?
quiz.hint: The part above ground is green like grass!

learning.summary: Cabbage forms tight, round heads of layered leaves! It comes in green, purple, and white varieties and can be eaten raw or cooked. The leaves grow in tight layers.
key_facts: Forms tight, round heads of leaves
Comes in green, purple, and white
Leaves are arranged in tight layers
Can be eaten raw or cooked
High in vitamin C and fiber

quiz.question: What shape does cabbage grow in?
quiz.hint: Cabbage forms ball-shaped bundles of leaves!

quiz.question: What colors can cabbage be?
quiz.hint: Cabbage comes in several different colors!

quiz.question: How are cabbage leaves arranged?
quiz.hint: Cabbage leaves wrap around each other like layers of an onion!

quiz.question: How can you eat cabbage?
quiz.hint: Think about coleslaw (raw) and cooked cabbage in soups!

learning.summary: Cauliflower looks like white broccoli and is also a flower we eat before it blooms! It grows in cool weather and has a mild, slightly sweet flavor. It can be white, purple, or orange.
key_facts: Also flowers we eat before blooming
Comes in white, purple, and orange varieties

quiz.question: What does cauliflower look like?
quiz.hint: Cauliflower is broccoli's white cousin!

quiz.question: What part of the plant is cauliflower?
quiz.hint: Just like broccoli, we eat the flower part!

quiz.question: What weather does cauliflower like?
quiz.hint: Cauliflower likes the same weather as broccoli!

quiz.question: What colors can cauliflower be?
quiz.hint: Cauliflower comes in more colors than just white!

learning.summary: Cucumbers are cool, refreshing vegetables that are mostly water! They grow on vines and have a mild flavor with crunchy texture. Perfect for hot summer days!
key_facts: High water content keeps you hydrated

quiz.question: What are cucumbers mostly made of?
quiz.hint: Cucumbers are like nature's water bottles!

quiz.question: Where do cucumbers grow?
quiz.hint: Cucumbers grow on climbing plants that need support!

quiz.question: What do cucumbers taste like?
quiz.hint: Cucumbers have a cool, clean taste!

quiz.question: When are cucumbers most refreshing?
quiz.hint: Think about when you'd most want something cool and watery!

learning.summary: Eggplants are purple, egg-shaped vegetables that grow on plants! They have a spongy texture that absorbs flavors well when cooking. Eggplants need warm weather to grow.
key_facts: Popular in Mediterranean and Asian cooking

quiz.question: What color are most eggplants?
quiz.hint: Eggplants are the same color as grapes!

quiz.question: What shape are eggplants?
quiz.hint: The name 'eggplant' gives you a clue about the shape!

quiz.question: What is eggplant's texture like?
quiz.hint: Eggplant soaks up flavors like a kitchen sponge!

quiz.question: What kind of weather do eggplants need?
quiz.hint: Eggplants like the same warm weather that tomatoes need!

learning.summary: Garlic grows underground as bulbs made up of individual cloves! It has a strong, pungent flavor and is used to add taste to many dishes. Garlic is also known for its health benefits.

quiz.question: Where does garlic grow?
quiz.hint: Like onions, garlic bulbs grow below the soil!

quiz.question: What is a garlic bulb made of?
quiz.hint: When you peel garlic, it separates into small pieces!

quiz.question: How does garlic taste?
quiz.hint: Garlic has a powerful taste that you can really notice!

quiz.question: Why is garlic used in cooking?
quiz.hint: Garlic makes food taste more interesting and delicious!

learning.summary: Mushrooms are actually fungi, not plants! They grow in dark, moist places and come in many varieties. Some mushrooms are safe to eat while others are not, so only eat store-bought ones!
key_facts: Some are safe to eat, others are not

quiz.question: What are mushrooms actually?
quiz.hint: Mushrooms are in their own special group, not plants or animals!

quiz.question: Where do mushrooms like to grow?
quiz.hint: Mushrooms like shady, damp spots like forests!

quiz.question: Are all wild mushrooms safe to eat?
quiz.hint: This is why you should only eat mushrooms from the store!

quiz.question: Where should you get mushrooms to eat?
quiz.hint: Store-bought mushrooms are safe because experts have checked them!

learning.summary: Onions grow underground as bulbs made of many layers! They have a strong flavor and are used in cooking all over the world. Onions can make you cry when you cut them!
key_facts: Strong flavor used worldwide in cooking
Can make you cry when cutting them
Come in different colors and sizes

quiz.question: Where do onions grow?
quiz.hint: Like garlic, onion bulbs grow below the soil!

quiz.question: What are onions made of?
quiz.hint: When you peel an onion, you remove layer after layer!

quiz.question: What happens when you cut onions?
quiz.hint: Onions release something that makes your eyes water!

quiz.question: Why are onions used in cooking?
quiz.hint: Onions make food taste better in cuisines around the world!

learning.summary: Pumpkins are large orange vegetables that grow on vines! They're rich in vitamins and can be used for both food and decoration. Pumpkin seeds are also nutritious and edible.
key_facts: Rich in vitamins A and C

quiz.question: What color are pumpkins?
quiz.hint: Pumpkins are the same color as carrots and basketballs!

quiz.question: How do pumpkins grow?
quiz.hint: Pumpkins grow on long, trailing plants along the ground!

quiz.question: What can you do with pumpkin seeds?
quiz.hint: Pumpkin seeds are nutritious snacks and can grow new pumpkins!

quiz.question: What holiday are pumpkins associated with?
quiz.hint: Think about jack-o'-lanterns and fall decorations!

learning.summary: Peppers come in many varieties from sweet to very hot! They grow on plants and change colors as they ripen. Hot peppers contain capsaicin which makes them spicy.
key_facts: Come in varieties from sweet to very hot

quiz.question: What makes hot peppers spicy?
quiz.hint: This special compound creates the burning sensation!

quiz.question: Where do peppers grow?
quiz.hint: Peppers grow on small, bushy plants in gardens!

quiz.question: What happens to peppers as they ripen?
quiz.hint: Many peppers start green and turn red, yellow, or other colors!

quiz.question: What varieties do peppers come in?
quiz.hint: From mild bell peppers to super hot ghost peppers!

learning.summary: Radishes are small, round root vegetables with a peppery, spicy taste! They grow quickly underground and come in red, white, and purple varieties. They're crunchy and often eaten raw.
key_facts: Come in red, white, and purple

quiz.question: Where do radishes grow?
quiz.hint: Like carrots, radishes are root vegetables that grow below soil!

quiz.question: How do radishes taste?
quiz.hint: Radishes have a sharp, zesty bite to them!

quiz.question: How quickly do radishes grow?
quiz.hint: Radishes are some of the fastest vegetables to grow!

quiz.question: How are radishes usually eaten?
quiz.hint: People often eat radishes fresh and crunchy in salads!

learning.summary: Spinach has dark green leaves packed with iron and vitamins! It grows quickly in cool weather and can be harvested as baby leaves or full-size. Great for strong muscles!
key_facts: Dark green leaves packed with iron
Can harvest as baby or full-size leaves

quiz.question: What color are spinach leaves?
quiz.hint: Spinach leaves are the deepest, richest green color!

quiz.question: What mineral is spinach famous for?
quiz.hint: This mineral helps make you strong, like the metal tools!

quiz.question: How fast does spinach grow?
quiz.hint: Spinach is like the speed racer of vegetables!

quiz.question: What does iron in spinach help with?
quiz.hint: Think about what Popeye the sailor was famous for!

learning.summary: Tomatoes are actually fruits, not vegetables, because they have seeds inside! They start green and turn red when ripe. Tomatoes need lots of sunlight and warm weather to grow.
key_facts: Start green, turn red when ripe

quiz.question: Are tomatoes fruits or vegetables?
quiz.hint: If it has seeds inside, it's technically a fruit!

quiz.question: What color do tomatoes turn when ripe?
quiz.hint: Ripe tomatoes are the color of fire trucks!

quiz.question: What do tomato plants need lots of?
quiz.hint: Tomatoes love to soak up the sun's rays!

quiz.question: What color are tomatoes before they ripen?
quiz.hint: Young tomatoes start the same color as leaves!

learning.summary: Zucchini is a summer squash that grows on large plants with big leaves! It has green skin and white flesh inside. Zucchini grows very quickly and can become quite large if left on the plant.
key_facts: Grows on large plants with big leaves
Can become very large if not harvested

quiz.question: What color is zucchini on the outside?
quiz.hint: Zucchini is the same color as grass and leaves!

quiz.question: What color is zucchini on the inside?
quiz.hint: The flesh inside is the color of snow!

quiz.question: How fast does zucchini grow?
quiz.hint: Zucchini can grow so fast it surprises gardeners!

quiz.question: What happens if you don't harvest zucchini?
quiz.hint: Some zucchini can grow as big as baseball bats!

fruits.name: Fruits
fruits.description: Sweet and nutritious foods that grow on trees, bushes, or vines

learning.summary: Apples are crunchy fruits that grow on trees in orchards! They bloom with flowers in spring and ripen in fall. Apples come in many varieties and are packed with fiber and vitamin C.
key_facts: Bloom in spring, ripen in fall
High in fiber and vitamin C
Can be eaten fresh or cooked

quiz.question: When do apple trees bloom?
quiz.hint: Apple flowers appear when many flowers bloom after winter!

quiz.question: When are apples ready to pick?
quiz.hint: Apples are harvested during Halloween season!

quiz.question: What vitamin do apples provide?
quiz.hint: This vitamin starts with 'C' and helps fight colds!

quiz.question: What helps your digestion in apples?
quiz.hint: This nutrient helps food move smoothly through your system!

learning.summary: Apricots are small, orange fruits with smooth skin and sweet-tart flavor! They grow on trees and are like tiny peaches without fuzz. Apricots are high in vitamin A and beta-carotene.
key_facts: Small, orange fruits with smooth skin
High in vitamin A and beta-carotene
Grow on trees in warm climates
Can be eaten fresh or dried

quiz.question: What do apricots look like compared to peaches?
quiz.hint: Apricots are like peaches' small, smooth cousins!

quiz.question: What color are apricots?
quiz.hint: Apricots are the same color as carrots and pumpkins!

quiz.question: What vitamin are apricots rich in?
quiz.hint: This vitamin is great for your eyes and skin!

quiz.question: How do apricots taste?
quiz.hint: Apricots have a mix of sweet and tangy flavors!

learning.summary: Bananas are sweet, soft fruits that grow in tropical places around the world! They grow in bunches on tall plants that look like trees. Bananas are yellow when ripe and are packed with potassium and natural energy.
key_facts: Grow in bunches on banana plants
Yellow when ripe, green when unripe
Have a peel you remove before eating

quiz.question: What color are ripe bananas?
quiz.hint: Ripe bananas are the same color as the sun!

quiz.question: What important nutrient are bananas famous for?
quiz.hint: This nutrient is great for your muscles and heart!

quiz.question: How do bananas grow?
quiz.hint: Many bananas grow together like a bunch of grapes!

quiz.question: Where do bananas grow best?
quiz.hint: Bananas love hot, humid weather near the equator!

learning.summary: Blueberries are small, round blue fruits that grow on bushes! They're considered a superfood because they're packed with antioxidants that help your brain stay sharp.
key_facts: Small, round blue fruits on bushes
Start green, turn blue when ripe

quiz.question: Where do blueberries grow?
quiz.hint: Blueberries grow on plants shorter than trees but taller than grass!

quiz.question: What color are ripe blueberries?
quiz.hint: The answer is right in their name!

quiz.question: What makes blueberries a superfood?
quiz.hint: These special compounds fight things that can harm your cells!

quiz.question: What do blueberries help with?
quiz.hint: Blueberries help the organ you use for thinking!

learning.summary: Blackberries are dark purple-black berries that grow on thorny bushes! They're made up of many tiny drupelets clustered together. Blackberries are high in vitamin C and fiber.
key_facts: High in vitamin C and fiber

quiz.question: What color are ripe blackberries?
quiz.hint: Despite their name, blackberries are actually very dark purple!

quiz.question: What are blackberries made of?
quiz.hint: Look closely at a blackberry - it's like many mini berries stuck together!

quiz.question: What do blackberry bushes have?
quiz.hint: Be careful when picking blackberries - the bushes are prickly!

quiz.question: What nutrients are blackberries high in?
quiz.hint: Blackberries give you vitamins for health and fiber for digestion!

learning.summary: Cantaloupe is a sweet, orange melon with a netted skin! It grows on vines along the ground and is very high in vitamin A and C. The flesh is juicy and refreshing.
key_facts: Sweet, orange melon with netted skin
Grows on vines along the ground
Very high in vitamins A and C

quiz.question: What color is cantaloupe inside?
quiz.hint: The inside is the same color as carrots and pumpkins!

quiz.question: What does cantaloupe skin look like?
quiz.hint: The outside looks like it's covered with a fishing net pattern!

quiz.question: How does cantaloupe grow?
quiz.hint: Like pumpkins, cantaloupe grows on trailing plants along the ground!

quiz.question: When is cantaloupe most refreshing?
quiz.hint: Think about when you'd most want something cool and juicy!

learning.summary: Cherries are small, round fruits that can be sweet or tart! They grow on trees with beautiful white or pink blossoms in spring. Cherries have a hard pit in the center.
key_facts: Small, round fruits that can be sweet or tart
Grow on trees with spring blossoms
Have a hard pit in the center
Come in red, dark red, or yellow varieties

quiz.question: What's inside every cherry?
quiz.hint: There's a hard stone in the center that you can't eat!

quiz.question: When do cherry trees bloom?
quiz.hint: Cherry blossoms are famous spring flowers!

quiz.question: What colors can cherries be?
quiz.hint: Cherries come in several different colors!

quiz.question: How do cherries taste?
quiz.hint: Some cherries are sweet while others have a tangy taste!

learning.summary: Figs are unique fruits with soft, sweet flesh and tiny seeds inside! They grow on trees and have been eaten for thousands of years. Figs can be eaten fresh or dried.
key_facts: Unique fruits with soft, sweet flesh
Grow on trees in warm climates
Been eaten for thousands of years
Can be eaten fresh or dried

quiz.question: What's inside a fig?
quiz.hint: Figs are full of very small seeds you can eat!

quiz.question: What is fig flesh like?
quiz.hint: Fig flesh is tender and has a natural sweetness!

quiz.question: How long have people been eating figs?
quiz.hint: Figs are one of the oldest fruits that humans have enjoyed!

quiz.question: How can figs be eaten?
quiz.hint: You can enjoy figs both fresh from the tree or dried as a snack!

learning.summary: Grapes are small, round fruits that grow in clusters on climbing vines! They come in green, red, and purple colors and can be sweet or tart. Grapes are great for heart health.
key_facts: Come in green, red, and purple colors

quiz.question: How do grapes grow?
quiz.hint: Think about how grapes are sold - they stick together in bunches!

quiz.question: Where do grapes grow?
quiz.hint: Grapes grow on long, climbing plants that need support!

quiz.question: What colors can grapes be?
quiz.hint: Think about all the different colored grapes at the store!

quiz.question: What do grapes become when dried?
quiz.hint: These wrinkled, sweet snacks are popular in trail mix!

learning.summary: Grapefruit is a large citrus fruit with a slightly bitter, tart taste! It has pink or white flesh inside and is very high in vitamin C. Grapefruit grows on trees in warm climates.
key_facts: Large citrus fruit with tart taste
Grows on trees in warm climates

quiz.question: What family does grapefruit belong to?
quiz.hint: Grapefruit is related to oranges and lemons!

quiz.question: What colors can grapefruit flesh be?
quiz.hint: Grapefruit comes in two main flesh colors!

quiz.question: How does grapefruit taste?
quiz.hint: Grapefruit has a sharper, more complex taste than oranges!

quiz.question: What vitamin is grapefruit rich in?
quiz.hint: Like other citrus fruits, grapefruit is full of this immune-boosting vitamin!

learning.summary: Kiwi fruits are small, brown, fuzzy fruits with bright green flesh inside dotted with tiny black seeds! They have a sweet-tart flavor and are packed with vitamin C.
key_facts: Bright green flesh with tiny black seeds

quiz.question: What color is kiwi inside?
quiz.hint: The inside is bright green like grass!

quiz.question: What does kiwi skin look like?
quiz.hint: Kiwi skin feels like a fuzzy peach!

quiz.question: What are the tiny black dots in kiwi?
quiz.hint: Those tiny black specks are actually edible seeds!

quiz.question: How does kiwi taste?
quiz.hint: Kiwi has a mix of sweet and tangy flavors!

learning.summary: Lemons are bright yellow citrus fruits with very tart, acidic flavor! They're packed with vitamin C and are essential for cooking and beverages. Lemon trees bloom with fragrant white flowers.

quiz.question: What can you make with lemon juice?
quiz.hint: A sweet and sour summer drink made with lemon juice!

quiz.question: What color are ripe lemons?
quiz.hint: Lemons are bright yellow like the sun!

quiz.question: How do lemons taste?
quiz.hint: Lemons are so sour they make your mouth pucker!

quiz.question: What vitamin do lemons have lots of?
quiz.hint: Like other citrus fruits, lemons are full of this vitamin!

learning.summary: Limes are small, green citrus fruits with a tart, acidic flavor! They're used in cooking and drinks around the world. Limes are high in vitamin C and citric acid.
key_facts: Used in cooking and drinks worldwide
High in vitamin C and citric acid

quiz.question: What color are limes?
quiz.hint: Limes are green like grass and leaves!

quiz.question: How do limes taste?
quiz.hint: Limes have a sharp, sour taste like lemons!

quiz.question: What family do limes belong to?
quiz.hint: Limes are cousins to lemons and oranges!

quiz.question: What vitamin are limes rich in?
quiz.hint: Like all citrus fruits, limes are full of this immune-boosting vitamin!

learning.summary: Mangoes are tropical fruits called the 'king of fruits'! They have sweet, creamy orange flesh and grow on tall trees in warm climates. Mangoes are very high in vitamins A and C.
key_facts: Grow on tall trees in tropical climates
Very high in vitamins A and C

quiz.question: What are mangoes sometimes called?
quiz.hint: Think about the royal title for a male ruler!

quiz.question: What color is mango flesh?
quiz.hint: The inside is the same color as carrots and pumpkins!

quiz.question: Where do mangoes grow?
quiz.hint: Mangoes grow high up where you'd need a ladder!

quiz.question: What climate do mangoes need?
quiz.hint: Think about places like islands and warm countries!

learning.summary: Nectarines are like peaches but with smooth skin instead of fuzzy! They have sweet, juicy flesh and a hard pit in the center. Nectarines are high in vitamins A and C.
key_facts: Like peaches but with smooth skin
High in vitamins A and C
Come in yellow and white varieties

quiz.question: How are nectarines different from peaches?
quiz.hint: Nectarines don't have the fuzzy feeling that peaches do!

quiz.question: What's in the center of a nectarine?
quiz.hint: Like peaches, nectarines have a hard stone in the middle!

quiz.question: How do nectarines taste?
quiz.hint: Nectarines have a delicious, sweet flavor like peaches!

quiz.question: What vitamins are nectarines high in?
quiz.hint: Nectarines give you vitamins for healthy eyes and immune system!

learning.summary: Oranges are citrus fruits packed with vitamin C! They have bright orange skin and juicy segments inside. Oranges grow on trees in warm, sunny places and are famous for their immune-boosting properties.
key_facts: Citrus fruits packed with vitamin C
Bright orange skin and juicy segments
Grow on trees in warm, sunny climates

quiz.question: What vitamin are oranges famous for?
quiz.hint: This vitamin starts with 'C' like 'citrus'!

quiz.question: How is the inside of an orange organized?
quiz.hint: When you peel an orange, it naturally breaks into wedge-shaped pieces!

quiz.question: What climate do orange trees need?
quiz.hint: Think about places like Florida and California!

quiz.question: How do oranges taste?
quiz.hint: Oranges have a perfect balance of sweetness and citrus tang!

learning.summary: Olives are small fruits that grow on trees and are processed to be edible! They're high in healthy fats and are pressed to make olive oil. Olives come in green and black varieties.
key_facts: Small fruits that grow on trees
Come in green and black varieties
Must be processed to be edible

quiz.question: What colors do olives come in?
quiz.hint: Olives come in two main colors!

quiz.question: What is made from pressed olives?
quiz.hint: This healthy cooking oil comes from squeezed olives!

quiz.question: What healthy fats do olives contain?
quiz.hint: Olives contain heart-healthy fats!

quiz.question: Can you eat olives straight from the tree?
quiz.hint: Raw olives are too bitter - they need special treatment first!

learning.summary: Papaya is a tropical fruit with bright orange flesh and black seeds in the center! It's very sweet and soft when ripe. Papayas grow on trees and are high in vitamins A and C.
key_facts: Tropical fruit with bright orange flesh
Black seeds in the center cavity
Very sweet and soft when ripe
Grows on trees in tropical climates
High in vitamins A and C

quiz.question: What color is papaya flesh?
quiz.hint: The inside is the same color as carrots!

quiz.question: What color are papaya seeds?
quiz.hint: The seeds in the center are dark like pepper!

quiz.question: How does ripe papaya feel?
quiz.hint: Ripe papaya is gentle and easy to eat!

quiz.question: What climate do papayas need?
quiz.hint: Papayas need warm, humid weather like pineapples!

learning.summary: Pomegranates are round fruits filled with hundreds of tiny seeds surrounded by juicy, ruby-red sacs called arils! They're very high in antioxidants and have been eaten for thousands of years.
key_facts: Round fruits filled with hundreds of seeds
Seeds surrounded by juicy ruby-red arils

quiz.question: What's inside a pomegranate?
quiz.hint: Pomegranates are packed full of tiny seeds!

quiz.question: What are the juicy parts around pomegranate seeds called?
quiz.hint: These are the juicy, red parts you eat!

quiz.question: What color are pomegranate arils?
quiz.hint: The juicy parts are red like precious gems!

quiz.question: What makes pomegranates special for health?
quiz.hint: Pomegranates are super high in compounds that fight cell damage!

learning.summary: Peaches are fuzzy, soft fruits with sweet, juicy flesh and a hard pit in the center! Their skin feels like velvet and they smell amazing when ripe. Peaches are high in vitamins A and C.
key_facts: Fuzzy, soft fruits with sweet flesh
High in vitamins A and C

quiz.question: What does peach skin feel like?
quiz.hint: Peach skin has a soft, fuzzy texture!

quiz.question: What's in the center of a peach?
quiz.hint: There's a hard stone in the middle that you can't eat!

quiz.question: How do ripe peaches smell?
quiz.hint: Ripe peaches have one of the best smells of any fruit!

quiz.question: What vitamins do peaches provide?
quiz.hint: Peaches give you vitamins for healthy eyes and immune system!

learning.summary: Pears are sweet, juicy fruits with a unique teardrop shape! They have a grainy texture when ripe and come in green and red varieties. Pears are high in fiber and vitamin C.
key_facts: Sweet, juicy fruits with teardrop shape
Come in green and red varieties
High in fiber and vitamin C

quiz.question: What shape are pears?
quiz.hint: Pears are wider at the bottom and narrow at the top!

quiz.question: What texture do ripe pears have?
quiz.hint: Pears have a unique, slightly gritty texture!

quiz.question: What colors can pears be?
quiz.hint: Pears come in different colors like apples do!

quiz.question: What happens to pears as they ripen?
quiz.hint: Ripe pears are gentle to touch!

learning.summary: Plums are smooth-skinned fruits with sweet, juicy flesh and a hard pit in the center! They come in purple, red, and yellow varieties. Plums are high in vitamins and antioxidants.
key_facts: Come in purple, red, and yellow varieties
Can be eaten fresh or dried as prunes

quiz.question: What kind of skin do plums have?
quiz.hint: Unlike peaches, plums have smooth skin!

quiz.question: What colors can plums be?
quiz.hint: Plums come in several beautiful colors!

quiz.question: What's in the center of a plum?
quiz.hint: Like peaches, plums have a hard stone in the middle!

quiz.question: What are dried plums called?
quiz.hint: When plums are dried, they get a special name!

learning.summary: Strawberries are heart-shaped red berries with seeds on the outside! They grow on low plants and are packed with vitamin C and antioxidants. Strawberries bloom with white flowers in spring.
key_facts: Packed with vitamin C and antioxidants

quiz.question: What shape are strawberries?
quiz.hint: Strawberries look like the symbol we use for love!

quiz.question: Where are strawberry seeds located?
quiz.hint: Look closely - you can see tiny dots all over the strawberry!

quiz.question: When do strawberries usually ripen?
quiz.hint: Strawberries are ready when school ends!

quiz.question: What color are strawberry flowers?
quiz.hint: The flowers are the opposite color of the fruit!

learning.summary: Tangerines are small, sweet citrus fruits that are easy to peel! They're similar to oranges but smaller and sweeter. Tangerines are high in vitamin C and perfect for snacking.
key_facts: Similar to oranges but smaller and sweeter

quiz.question: How are tangerines different from oranges?
quiz.hint: Tangerines are like oranges' little sweet cousins!

quiz.question: What makes tangerines good for snacking?
quiz.hint: The skin comes off easily, making them perfect for lunch boxes!

quiz.question: What family do tangerines belong to?
quiz.hint: Tangerines are relatives of oranges and lemons!

quiz.question: What vitamin do tangerines provide?
quiz.hint: Like all citrus fruits, tangerines are full of this immune-boosting vitamin!

learning.summary: Watermelons are huge, round fruits with green rinds and juicy red flesh inside! They're mostly water and perfect for hot summer days. Watermelon seeds can be black or white.
key_facts: Huge, round fruits with green rinds
Juicy red flesh that's mostly water
Seeds can be black or white

quiz.question: What is watermelon mostly made of?
quiz.hint: The name gives you a big clue!

quiz.question: What color is watermelon flesh?
quiz.hint: The inside is bright red like fire trucks!

quiz.question: When is watermelon most refreshing?
quiz.hint: Think about when you'd most want something cool and watery!

quiz.question: How big are watermelons?
quiz.hint: Watermelons are some of the biggest fruits!

dairy.name: Dairy
dairy.description: Foods that come from milk and help build strong bones and teeth

learning.summary: Butter is made from cream that's churned until it becomes thick and creamy! It's rich in fat and adds flavor to foods. Butter is used for cooking, baking, and spreading on bread.

quiz.question: What is butter made from?
quiz.hint: Butter comes from the fatty part of milk!

quiz.question: How is butter made?
quiz.hint: Making butter involves mixing cream until it gets thick!

quiz.question: What does butter add to food?
quiz.hint: Butter makes food taste richer and more delicious!

quiz.question: What is butter's texture like?
quiz.hint: Butter is soft enough to spread on toast!

learning.summary: Cheese is made from milk that's been curdled and aged! It comes in many varieties like cheddar, mozzarella, and swiss. Cheese is rich in protein and calcium, making it both delicious and nutritious.

quiz.question: What is cheese made from?
quiz.hint: Cheese starts with the white liquid we get from cows!

quiz.question: What nutrients is cheese rich in?
quiz.hint: Cheese helps build strong muscles and bones!

quiz.question: Which is a type of cheese?
quiz.hint: This orange cheese is very popular!

quiz.question: How is milk turned into cheese?
quiz.hint: The milk gets thick and chunky before becoming cheese!

learning.summary: Cream is the rich, fatty part of milk that rises to the top! It's thick and smooth, perfect for making desserts, coffee drinks, and sauces. Cream comes in different types like heavy cream and light cream.
key_facts: Comes in heavy and light varieties

quiz.question: What part of milk is cream?
quiz.hint: Cream is the richest part of milk!

quiz.question: Where does cream naturally go in milk?
quiz.hint: Fat is lighter than water, so it floats up!

quiz.question: What is cream's texture like?
quiz.hint: Cream is much thicker than regular milk!

quiz.question: What can cream be used for?
quiz.hint: Cream makes things taste rich and creamy!

learning.summary: Cottage cheese is a soft, white cheese with small curds that look like tiny lumps! It's made from milk that's been curdled gently. Cottage cheese is high in protein and has a mild, creamy taste.

quiz.question: What does cottage cheese look like?
quiz.hint: The lumps are called curds!

quiz.question: How is cottage cheese made?
quiz.hint: The milk is curdled more gently than for hard cheeses!

quiz.question: What nutrient is cottage cheese high in?
quiz.hint: This nutrient helps build strong muscles!

quiz.question: What does cottage cheese taste like?
quiz.hint: Cottage cheese has a gentle, not strong flavor!

learning.summary: Ice cream is a frozen treat made from milk, cream, and sugar! It's churned while freezing to make it smooth and creamy. Ice cream comes in many flavors like vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry.

quiz.question: What is ice cream made from?
quiz.hint: Ice cream is made from dairy products plus something sweet!

quiz.question: How is ice cream different from just frozen milk?
quiz.hint: Churning makes ice cream smooth instead of icy!

quiz.question: What temperature is ice cream served at?
quiz.hint: Ice cream needs to stay cold or it melts!

quiz.question: Name a common ice cream flavor:
quiz.hint: This flavor is white and very popular!

learning.summary: Milk is a white liquid that comes from cows and other animals! It's full of important nutrients like protein, calcium, and vitamins. Milk helps us grow strong bones and teeth, and we use it for drinking, cereal, and making other dairy products.
key_facts: Helps build strong bones and teeth
Used to make other dairy products

quiz.question: What color is milk?
quiz.hint: Milk is the color of snow!

quiz.question: What animal commonly gives us milk?
quiz.hint: This big farm animal says 'moo'!

quiz.question: What does milk help make strong?
quiz.hint: Milk has calcium which is great for your skeleton!

quiz.question: What can milk be used for?
quiz.hint: Think about breakfast time!

learning.summary: Yogurt is made from milk that has been fermented with good bacteria! These helpful bacteria make the milk thick and tangy. Yogurt is creamy, healthy, and comes in many flavors. It's great for your digestive system!

quiz.question: How is yogurt made?
quiz.hint: Good bacteria help turn milk into yogurt!

quiz.question: What does yogurt taste like?
quiz.hint: Yogurt has a slightly sour but pleasant taste!

quiz.question: What makes yogurt good for you?
quiz.hint: These helpful bacteria are called probiotics!

quiz.question: What part of your body does yogurt help?
quiz.hint: Yogurt helps your stomach and intestines work better!

fats.name: Healthy Fats
fats.description: Foods with good fats that give you energy and help your body work properly

learning.summary: Coconuts are large, brown, fibrous fruits that grow on palm trees! Inside is white coconut meat and coconut water. Coconuts are high in healthy fats and can be eaten fresh or dried.
key_facts: Contain white meat and coconut water
Can be eaten fresh or dried

quiz.question: Where do coconuts grow?
quiz.hint: Coconuts grow on tall tropical trees!

quiz.question: What's inside a coconut?
quiz.hint: Coconuts have both solid and liquid parts inside!

quiz.question: What does coconut meat look like?
quiz.hint: The meat inside is white like snow!

quiz.question: What nutrients are coconuts high in?
quiz.hint: Coconuts are one of the few fruits that are high in good fats!

learning.summary: Butter is made from cream that's churned until it becomes thick and creamy. It's rich in saturated fats and adds delicious flavor to foods. Butter is used for cooking, baking, and spreading on bread. It's solid at room temperature but melts easily when heated.

quiz.question: What happens to butter when heated?
What type of fats does butter contain?

learning.summary: Chocolate comes from cacao beans that grow in pods on cacao trees. The beans are processed and mixed with sugar and milk to make different types of chocolate. Dark chocolate has healthy antioxidants and some fats, while milk chocolate is sweeter and creamier.
key_facts: Grows on cacao trees in warm climates
Comes in milk, dark, and white varieties

quiz.question: What do cacao beans grow on?
Which type of chocolate has the most antioxidants?
What makes chocolate sweet and creamy?

learning.summary: Nuts are seeds with hard shells that grow on trees and plants. They include almonds, walnuts, cashews, and peanuts. Nuts are packed with healthy fats, protein, and vitamins that give your body energy and help your brain work well. They make great snacks and can be used in cooking.
key_facts: High in healthy fats and protein
Good for brain health and energy

quiz.question: What part of the body do nuts help?

learning.summary: Salmon is a pink fish that lives in both oceans and rivers. It's famous for being rich in omega-3 fatty acids, which are very healthy fats that help your heart and brain. Salmon swim upstream to lay their eggs and are caught wild or raised on fish farms.
key_facts: Pink fish that lives in oceans and rivers
Good for heart and brain health

quiz.question: What healthy fats does salmon contain?
What do salmon do to lay eggs?
